column4: where do i go for help with compiling an ubuntu source package, when it tells me dependencies are broken
have you typed "sudo apt-get build-dep packagename"?
Yes... that also fails
you mean that command fails, or compiling fails after that command?
sorry... E: Build-dependencies for gnome-utils could not be satisfied.
it seems to work for me on Hardy; i guess you're on Karmic? maybe it's bug filing time
thanks anyways
pastebin your /etc/apt/sources.list please
standby....
you have neither the -updates nor the -security repositories enabled. that's not good.
i dont remember touching any of this stuff ever, its a default netbook install... how do i fix ?
replace your list with this amended one: http://paste.ubuntu.com/330312/
then type "sudo apt-get update ; sudo apt-get dist-upgrade". it'll probably download a fair bit of packages, if you never had these enabled before.
doesn't dist-upgrade put me to 9.10?
uh, not really
145 MB over my 3g cell phone modem... here goes nothin'
well, jaunty has been out for quite a long time, so you have a lot of package updates to catch up on...
: I want to say thank you for pointing me to the problem, sudo apt-get build-dep is working now. apparently netbook remix doesn't come with updates enabled in sources.list ?
apparently. doesn't seem like a very good idea though.
thanks again for help. im buggin' out
you're welcome, bye
